==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|じゅ|そ|yomi=o}}
{{IPAchar|/ɕuso/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑuso/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じゅそ}} compound {{m|zh|呪詛|tr=tsyuw<sup>H</sup>? tsu<sup>X</sup>?|lit=curse + curse, pledge}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|咒詛}}.

The reading of the first character shifted from the regular [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading of ''shu'' to the [[慣用音#Japanese|kan'yōon]] reading of ''ju''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|じゅそ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|呪咀}}, {{ja-l|咒詛}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じゅそ}}

# [[curse]], [[malediction]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|呪い|のろい}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb-suru|じゅそ|tr=trans}}

# to [[curse]] someone or something

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-suru|じゅそ}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
The {{m|ja|直音表記|tr=chokuon hyōki|lit=straight-sound spelling}} of ''juso'' above. Most common from the [[w:Heian period|Heian]] through the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi]] periods.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

It is unclear if the pronunciation itself also shifted, or just the spelling.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ずそ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ずそ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ずそ|obsolete}} [[curse]], [[malediction]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|呪い|のろい}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb-suru|ずそ|tr=trans}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ずそ|obsolete}} to [[curse]] someone or something
